data.prayer: Father, guide the church in Khagrachhari, Chittagong, Bangladesh to see their community as a holy priesthood, offering spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God.
data.verse: you also, like living stones, are being built into a spiritual house to be a holy priesthood, offering spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God through Jesus Christ.

data.location_label: Photo from the county of Khagrachhari, Chittagong, Bangladesh
data.section_summary: What beauty can God be thanked for in this photo?

data.prayer: Spirit, help the disciples in the county of Khagrachhari to find a person of peace today, like the Philippian jailer, who heard and was immediately baptized with his whole family.
data.verse: And they spoke the word of the Lord to him and to all who were in his house. And he took them the same hour of the night and washed their wounds; and he was baptized at once, he and all his family.

data.prayer: Spirit, teach those feeling unsafe in Khagrachhari, Chittagong, Bangladesh that they can hide under your wings
data.verse: He will cover you with his feathers, and under his wings you will find refuge; his faithfulness will be your shield and rampart.

data.prayer: Spirit, please give new believers a yearning to see you praised in Khagrachhari, Chittagong, Bangladesh.
data.verse: Declare his glory among the nations, his marvelous deeds among all peoples.

data.prayer: Father, 0.0% are known to be believers. Please, Lord call more today.
Father, please send teachers of your Word in Khagrachhari who can speak your gospel boldly and clearly.
Spirit, disrupt complacency in the 769 believers living in the county of Khagrachhari. Remind them you are coming soon.
data.verse: Therefore, stay awake, for you do not know on what day your Lord is coming.

data.prayer: God, we pray for the believers in Khagrachhari, Chittagong, Bangladesh to be generous so that they would be worthy of greater investment by you.

location.name: Khagrachhari
location.people_groups_list: Lohar (Muslim traditions), Kaibartta Jalia, Rohingya Zerbadi, Kaibartta, Kalal (Hindu traditions)
